item.title: Paul Ryan Sells Health Care Bill As A 'Once-In-A-Lifetime Opportunity'
item.description: March 9, 2017 - With conservative lawmakers and interest groups blasting the Republican health care overhaul effort, the House speaker is making a hard sell for his bill.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 9, 2017 - With conservative lawmakers and interest groups blasting the Republican health care overhaul effort, the House speaker is making a hard sell for his bill. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/09/519484050/paul-ryan-sells-health-care-bill-as-a-once-in-a-lifetime-opportunity

item.title: Scientists Closer To Creating A Fully Synthetic Yeast Genome
item.description: March 9, 2017 - An international consortium of researchers has synthesized about a third of the genetic code of baker's yeast. It's an important milestone in science's quest to create complex "synthetic life."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 9, 2017 - An international consortium of researchers has synthesized about a third of the genetic code of baker's yeast. It's an important milestone in science's quest to create complex "synthetic life." http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/09/518990577/scientists-closer-to-creating-a-fully-synthetic-yeast-genome

item.title: Medical, Hospital Groups Oppose GOP Health Care Plan
item.description: March 9, 2017 - Associations of doctors, nurses and hospitals say the bill, under review in Congress, will likely reduce coverage and hurt Americans' health. Among the critics is Medicaid's chief medical officer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 9, 2017 - Associations of doctors, nurses and hospitals say the bill, under review in Congress, will likely reduce coverage and hurt Americans' health. Among the critics is Medicaid's chief medical officer. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/09/519450642/medical-hospital-groups-oppose-gop-health-care-plan

item.title: Looking Into The Horse Milk Story That The Dalai Lama Told John Oliver
item.description: March 9, 2017 - The spiritual leader says he brought down Mongolia's rate of alcoholism by encouraging a switch from vodka to horse milk.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 9, 2017 - The spiritual leader says he brought down Mongolia's rate of alcoholism by encouraging a switch from vodka to horse milk. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/09/519226175/looking-into-the-horse-milk-story-that-the-dalai-lama-told-john-oliver

item.title: 5 Key Takeaways From The GOP Health Overhaul Plan
item.description: March 9, 2017 - The bill proposes big changes to state and federal Medicaid programs and tax advantages for people who can afford to save up for health care costs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 9, 2017 - The bill proposes big changes to state and federal Medicaid programs and tax advantages for people who can afford to save up for health care costs. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/09/519304881/5-things-to-watch-with-the-gop-health-law-overhaul

item.title: Trump, Democrats Look For Common Ground On Drug Prices
item.description: March 8, 2017 - Two congressmen met with President Trump seeking support for a bill to expand the government's ability to negotiate drug prices. But it's not clear it would have much impact or will gain support.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - Two congressmen met with President Trump seeking support for a bill to expand the government's ability to negotiate drug prices. But it's not clear it would have much impact or will gain support. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/08/519306444/trump-dems-look-for-common-ground-on-drug-prices

item.title: Some Neanderthals Were Vegetarian — And They Likely Kissed Our Human Ancestors
item.description: March 8, 2017 - A new study of the dental plaques of three Neanderthals reveals surprising facts about their lives, including what they ate, the diseases that ailed them and how they self-medicated (and smooched).
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - A new study of the dental plaques of three Neanderthals reveals surprising facts about their lives, including what they ate, the diseases that ailed them and how they self-medicated (and smooched). http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/08/519048010/some-neanderthals-were-vegetarian-and-they-likely-kissed-our-human-ancestors

item.title: House Committees Begin Debate On Republican Health Care Bill
item.description:
March 8, 2017 - Two House committees are debating Wednesday on a Republican to overhaul the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/03/08/519282223/house-committees-begin-debate-on-republican-health-care-bill
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: AARP Policy Director Criticizes Republican Health Care Plan
item.description: March 8, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to David Certner, legislative policy director for the AARP, about the House Republicans' heath care reform proposal.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to David Certner, legislative policy director for the AARP, about the House Republicans' heath care reform proposal. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/08/519282174/aarp-policy-director-criticizes-republican-health-care-plan

item.title: How Will The GOP Health Care Plan Affect Insurance Costs?
item.description: March 8, 2017 - As Congress begins the process of amending the Republican health care bill, listeners tell us how the proposed plan will affect their insurance costs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - As Congress begins the process of amending the Republican health care bill, listeners tell us how the proposed plan will affect their insurance costs. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/08/519282167/how-will-the-gop-health-care-plan-affect-insurance-costs

item.title: Maybe You, Too, Could Become A Super Memorizer
item.description: March 8, 2017 - After six weeks of training, people could memorize twice as much. Areas of the brain had begun communicating in new ways — a lot like what happens inside the heads of world memory champions.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - After six weeks of training, people could memorize twice as much. Areas of the brain had begun communicating in new ways — a lot like what happens inside the heads of world memory champions. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/08/518815297/maybe-you-too-could-become-a-super-memorizer

item.title: Trump Won Big In House Conservatives' Districts — Will They Defy Him On Health Care?
item.description: March 8, 2017 - Members of the House Freedom Caucus and their allies are rebuking the Republican leadership's health care bill, but many of their constituents voted for President Trump. Can the lawmakers be swayed?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - Members of the House Freedom Caucus and their allies are rebuking the Republican leadership's health care bill, but many of their constituents voted for President Trump. Can the lawmakers be swayed? http://www.npr.org/2017/03/08/519091030/freedom-caucus-members-face-crossroads-over-health-care-proposal

item.title: GOP Health Bill Faces Criticism As Committee Work Begins
item.description: March 8, 2017 - Fending off attacks from the left and the right, House GOP leaders begin the process of amending their American Health Care Act, which would replace Obamacare.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - Fending off attacks from the left and the right, House GOP leaders begin the process of amending their American Health Care Act, which would replace Obamacare. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/08/519212461/gop-health-bill-faces-criticism-as-committee-work-begins

item.title: Analysis: GOP Health Plan May Not Fix The Problems They Want To Fix
item.description: March 8, 2017 - The House Republican health care proposal to replace Obamacare may not cut costs, increase choices or boost coverage in the end.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - The House Republican health care proposal to replace Obamacare may not cut costs, increase choices or boost coverage in the end. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/08/519059382/republicans-health-plan-may-not-fix-the-problems-they-want-to-fix

item.title: Affordable Care Act Architect On The New Republican Plan
item.description: March 8, 2017 - A difficult part of implementing a new health care law is providing health insurance to the sick and underserved. Steve Inskeep talks with MIT economist and Obamacare architect Jonathan Gruber.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - A difficult part of implementing a new health care law is providing health insurance to the sick and underserved. Steve Inskeep talks with MIT economist and Obamacare architect Jonathan Gruber. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/08/519170702/affordable-care-act-architect-on-the-new-republican-plan
